programme.title: Nine Months
Dziewięć miesięcy
Nine Months
programme.desc: Nine Months: Directed by Chris Columbus. With Hugh Grant, Julianne Moore, Tom Arnold, Joan Cusack. When he finds out his longtime girlfriend is pregnant, a commitment-phobe realizes he might have to change his lifestyle for better or much, much worse." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0113986/","name":"Nine Months","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2U3YTQzYWYtZTBlYi00ZmJjLTkzMjAtOTljYmE5MThhNzk5L2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"When he finds out his longtime girlfriend is pregnant, a commitment-phobe realizes he might have to change his lifestyle for better or much, much worse.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0113986/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"venom_701"},"dateCreated":"2003-08-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Argument For Sterilization","reviewBody":""Nine Months" is a predictable chick flick, where a very happy, content bachelor knocks up his live-in girlfriend, thereby turning his world upside-down. Lessons learned: men who don't want to marry and have children are portrayed as immature, self-absorbed, selfish, and misguided. Carting lots of screaming kids around in a minivan is, apparently, the most fun a man can have in this lifetime. For women, having children is the ultimate achievement and fulfillment of their lives. This is an insulting fairy tale that women will love, because it shows men who don't want marriage and kids as BAD and men who do want marriage and kids as GOOD. Women are always GOOD no matter what their attitude or actions are."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":36120,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"1995-07-12","keywords":"time for title,bad dream,close up of eyes,close up of lips,close up of mouth","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Nine Months","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2812084505","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjljYWMxZTUtNTQxYy00Yjc2LWI3MDEtYTNiYTQzMDZiMzE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjljYWMxZTUtNTQxYy00Yjc2LWI3MDEtYTNiYTQzMDZiMzE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from 20th Century Fox"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000424/","name":"Hugh Grant"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000194/","name":"Julianne Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000792/","name":"Tom Arnold"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001060/","name":"Chris Columbus"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046151/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0105317/","name":"Patrick Braoudé"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001060/","name":"Chris Columbus"}],"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Paper Towns
Papierowe miasta
Paper Towns
programme.desc:
Paper Towns: Directed by Jake Schreier. With Nat Wolff, Cara Delevingne, Austin Abrams, Justice Smith. After an all-night adventure, Quentin's lifelong crush, Margo, disappears, leaving behind clues that Quentin and his friends follow on the journey of a lifetime." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3622592/","name":"Paper Towns","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE2ODQxODMwOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDY5NjY3NDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After an all-night adventure, Quentin's lifelong crush, Margo, disappears, leaving behind clues that Quentin and his friends follow on the journey of a lifetime.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3622592/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mr-ddesouza"},"dateCreated":"2015-12-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed watching this film!","reviewBody":"Is it worth the price of a rental? Yes.

I absolutely loved this movie! As 3 friends come to the end of their senior year. Quentin (played by Nat Wolff) sets out on an adventure likes he's never had before. There is very little that disappointed me in this film. As a matter of fact, my only real complaint was the character of Margo (played by Cara Delevingne), I can't quite put my finger on it but i found her character to be annoying throughout the first act. She was very monotone although she had this opinionated know it all attitude. 

However, since most of the film after that is about finding Margo, her character is not a problem anymore. I realize that the genre of the film is "Drama, Mystery, Romance", I think it is safe to add Adventure , Comedy to the mix. This film made good on the mystery of Margo while adding the adventure of the night before she goes missing along with the adventure that Quentin embarks throughout this entire film looking for Margo. I also found the movie to be very funny with best friends like Radar (played by Justice Smith) and Ben (played by Ben Abrams). These two have completely different characters from one another but together make for a great and funny friendship. Much comedic relief comes from the interaction of the two best friends alone and the scenes where it's all three of them.

I liked the cinematography in this film very much. There were pretty lens flares that I thought were suitable for this type of film and in the scenes that they used them. There was something about the slow motion car shots that I loved as well. A good use of shallow depth of field to concentrate on solely one character at times and no shots that were visually a distraction that I noticed.

I loved all the music that they put into the film. This was a definite plus for me.

Lastly, I love the message of this film. A young man graduating from high school with his whole future planned (college, marriage, kids, career) only to realize that life is more than just those things. That you can have an adventure through it all and that friends are so important and that you need to cherish friendships and enjoy them to the fullest before everyone goes their separate ways. This is a movie that I would recommend anyone watch. Live life to the fullest, have an adventure and don't let life pass you by. I am definitely planning on watching this film again in the near future. Hopefully I can better describe the feeling it gives me when I do.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":98894,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-07-24","keywords":"based on novel,travel,teenage girl,unrequited love,friendship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2452795417","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkyNjAxNDc3MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDMxNDg4NTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkyNjAxNDc3MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDMxNDg4NTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A coming-of-age story centering on Quentin and his enigmatic neighbor Margo, who loved mysteries so much she became one. After taking him on an all-night adventure through their hometown, Margo suddenly disappears - leaving behind cryptic clues for Quentin to decipher. The search leads Quentin and his quick-witted friends on an exhilarating adventure that is equal parts hilarious and moving. Ultimately, to track down Margo, Quentin must find a deeper understanding of true friendship - and true love."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1822659/","name":"Nat Wolff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5353321/","name":"Cara Delevingne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3641002/","name":"Austin Abrams"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1500577/","name":"Jake Schreier"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017497/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0069651/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2354099/","name":"Scott Neustadter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2352210/","name":"Michael H. After an all-night adventure, Quentin's lifelong crush, Margo, disappears, leaving behind clues that Quentin and his friends follow on the journey of a lifetime." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3622592/","name":"Paper Towns","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE2ODQxODMwOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDY5NjY3NDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After an all-night adventure, Quentin's lifelong crush, Margo, disappears, leaving behind clues that Quentin and his friends follow on the journey of a lifetime.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3622592/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"mr-ddesouza","dateCreated":"2015-12-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed watching this film!","reviewBody":"Is it worth the price of a rental? Yes.

I absolutely loved this movie! As 3 friends come to the end of their senior year. Quentin (played by Nat Wolff) sets out on an adventure likes he's never had before. There is very little that disappointed me in this film. As a matter of fact, my only real complaint was the character of Margo (played by Cara Delevingne), I can't quite put my finger on it but i found her character to be annoying throughout the first act. She was very monotone although she had this opinionated know it all attitude. 

However, since most of the film after that is about finding Margo, her character is not a problem anymore. I realize that the genre of the film is "Drama, Mystery, Romance", I think it is safe to add Adventure , Comedy to the mix. This film made good on the mystery of Margo while adding the adventure of the night before she goes missing along with the adventure that Quentin embarks throughout this entire film looking for Margo. I also found the movie to be very funny with best friends like Radar (played by Justice Smith) and Ben (played by Ben Abrams). These two have completely different characters from one another but together make for a great and funny friendship. Much comedic relief comes from the interaction of the two best friends alone and the scenes where it's all three of them.

I liked the cinematography in this film very much. There were pretty lens flares that I thought were suitable for this type of film and in the scenes that they used them. There was something about the slow motion car shots that I loved as well. A good use of shallow depth of field to concentrate on solely one character at times and no shots that were visually a distraction that I noticed.

I loved all the music that they put into the film. This was a definite plus for me.

Lastly, I love the message of this film. A young man graduating from high school with his whole future planned (college, marriage, kids, career) only to realize that life is more than just those things. That you can have an adventure through it all and that friends are so important and that you need to cherish friendships and enjoy them to the fullest before everyone goes their separate ways. This is a movie that I would recommend anyone watch. Live life to the fullest, have an adventure and don't let life pass you by. I am definitely planning on watching this film again in the near future. Hopefully I can better describe the feeling it gives me when I do.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":98894,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-07-24","keywords":"based on novel,travel,teenage girl,unrequited love,friendship","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2452795417","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkyNjAxNDc3MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDMxNDg4NTE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkyNjAxNDc3MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDMxNDg4NTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A coming-of-age story centering on Quentin and his enigmatic neighbor Margo, who loved mysteries so much she became one. programme.title: Time Freak
Zakochany geniusz
Time Freak
programme.desc:
Time Freak: Directed by Andrew Bowler. With Asa Butterfield, Sophie Turner, Skyler Gisondo, Will Peltz. A genius teenage boy is in love with a girl who breaks up after a year. He invents a time-machine and tries to fix the break-up repeatedly. He finally goes a year back with his friend/advisor to fix the bad days." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6769280/","name":"Time Freak","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzhmMzI5MDItODg2My00M2IxLTgxMGItNTZkYWIxNWVkMDNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyOTg4MDYyNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A genius teenage boy is in love with a girl who breaks up after a year. He invents a time-machine and tries to fix the break-up repeatedly. He finally goes a year back with his friend/advisor to fix the bad days.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6769280/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"thekarmicnomad"},"dateCreated":"2018-11-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"More heart than mind - not much Sci-Fi to see here.","reviewBody":"A boy-genius meets the love of his life. A few months later they have split up - cue the time machine to get her back.

At first glance I knew I had definitely been here before - but I was wrong.

On the surface you can enjoy this as a very simple, quaint romance with the odd joke thrown in.

The sci-fi element of this is kept on the down low. There are no annoying sequences about paradoxes, dichotomies or accidentally shagging your own parents here. This is all about the relationships of the three main characters and the choices we make in life.

Straight away the leads do not look like they are an actual couple and I assumed their chemistry would be garbage.

This, however, is one of the strengths of the film and what sets it apart.

This will really resonate with anyone who (like me) has gone out with someone who is clearly hotter and more vivacious than themselves. There was something painfully familiar seeing the lead character snowballing trivial disagreements in to major issues due to a lack-of-confidence, fear and jealousy. Then of course the harder he tries to fix things the more damage he causes.

The characters are great in this; they are so believable they almost feel like people from my actual past. The story is simple but non-judgmental - I found myself rooting for all parties involved all the time.

Despite having some depth this remains a nice light watch, there is no nudity, violence, political agendas, and it won't stretch your brains or emotions too far either.

An excellent watch!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":8128,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2018-11-07","keywords":"based on short film,time travel,young love,coming of age,teenage boy","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3467622937","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWI3NzU4NDQtM2RkZC00ZGY1LWJhOTgtNThmZjBkZGM2NWY4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWI3NzU4NDQtM2RkZC00ZGY1LWJhOTgtNThmZjBkZGM2NWY4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Physics prodigy Stillman (Butterfield) is destined for great things, only to be derailed when his girlfriend, Debbie (Turner) suddenly dumps him. But Stillman isn't beaten, he does what any heartbroken genius would do - he invents a time machine to get a second chance at love."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2633535/","name":"Asa Butterfield"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3849842/","name":"Sophie Turner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1711114/","name":"Skyler Gisondo"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1577772/","name":"Andrew Bowler"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0555595/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0564574/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0636796/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1577772/","name":"Andrew Bowler"}],"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Hollywood Buzz
programme.desc: W programie nowości kinowe, relacje z planów zdjęciowych oraz ciekawostki związanych z gwiazdami srebrnego ekranu. O pracy nad najnowszymi hollywoodzkimi produkcjami opowiadają ich twórcy - znani reżyserzy i aktorzy. Autorzy magazynu przedstawiają również zwiastuny filmów wchodzących na ekrany kin.

I'm half thinking the makers had some intent to create the most cringeworthy mess possible."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9427,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2019-06-28","keywords":"shakespeare's hamlet,gertrude character,ophelia character,title directed by female,denmark","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3975527449","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWQ4NmM0ODQtMDZkNS00NTYwLTgzNzQtMzBmZjVkY2FiM2I2XkEyXkFqcGdeQW1yb3NzZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWQ4NmM0ODQtMDZkNS00NTYwLTgzNzQtMzBmZjVkY2FiM2I2XkEyXkFqcGdeQW1yb3NzZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Set in the 14th Century, 'Ophelia' is a re-imagining of Shakespeare's "Hamlet." Ophelia (Daisy Ridley) takes center stage as Queen Gertrude's (Naomi Watts) most trusted lady-in-waiting. Beautiful and intelligent, she soon captures the attention of the handsome Prince Hamlet (George MacKay) and a forbidden love blossoms. As war brews, lust and betrayal are tearing Elsinore Castle apart from within and Ophelia must decide between her true love or her own life in order to protect a very dangerous secret."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5397459/","name":"Daisy Ridley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6731603/","name":"Mia Quiney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9058955/","name":"Calum O'Rourke"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2113122/","name":"Claire McCarthy"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0551691/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0207528/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0457787/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0155069/","name":"Semi Chellas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8120239/","name":"Lisa Klein"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000636/","name":"William Shakespeare"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Mała Misia (Klaudia Kurak) i jej mama (Sylwia Boroń) spędzają wczasy w domu nad jeziorem. Pewnego razu dziewczynka wypowiada życzenia, aby despotyczny ojciec (Michał Jóźwik) znikł z jej życia. Wypowiada życzenie...

programme.title: The East
Ida
programme.desc:
The East: Directed by Zal Batmanglij. With Brit Marling, Alexander Skarsgård, Elliot Page, Toby Kebbell. An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities changing dramatically after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1869716/","name":"The East","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEyNjQzMzg5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjExNzU1OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities changing dramatically after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1869716/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Emma_Stewart"},"dateCreated":"2013-05-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"An outstanding addition to Brit Marling's repertoire","reviewBody":"Since 2011's Another Earth landed at Sundance and nabbed the Special Jury Prize, Brit Marling has quickly cemented herself as one of the most exciting and challenging new talents. When she feels a genre hasn't been explored to its full potential, she takes it further. When she notices women her age are typecast in boring roles, she writes her own. She's a visionary filmmaker with something to say and the talent and ambition to make sure she's heard - her second collaboration with director and co- writer Zal Batmanglij, The East, is no exception, and is perhaps the peak of her already illustrious career so far. 

The film follows Jane Owen (Marling), an undercover security agent, as she leaves behind her doting boyfriend (Jason Ritter) to infiltrate an eco-terrorist group known as The East, who have publicly targeted massive corporations for their covered-up crimes against humans and nature. In between reports to her icy, amoral boss (Patricia Clarkson), Jane slowly grows fascinated with the group, its morals and goals, and its core (Alexander Skarsgard, Ellen Page, Shiloh Fernandez, Toby Kebbell), observing with a mix of horror and infatuation as they execute their violent "jams" on the corporations' key members. 

The East will inevitably draw comparisons to Sean Durkin's Martha Marcy May Marlene because of the subject matter and its ingenue leading lady.The East is not as much of a psychological profile, but there are interesting similarities - like Durkin, Batmanglij and Marling never really villainize or condemn their subects; instead, they make a point of showing the East's appeal. We, the audience, begin to understand why these troubled young people would find solace and purpose in what is essentially a band of guerrilla terrorists, and, in turn, why Jane is so hypnotized by them. It makes for an uncomfortably provocative watch: as we learn more about the characters, their backgrounds, and the corporations' crimes (which are based in fact), it's hard to determine who the "bad guys" are. I saw the film at a festival where Batmanglij gave a short Q&A after and he revealed that he, Marling, and Page had lived with similar groups (without the terrorism) before and were sympathetic with the East's cause, if not their methods. The sympathy shows in the writing and most of the time that's a good thing, but there are times when it gets closer to bias and muddies otherwise brilliant storytelling - but these are blips in the overall outstanding product. 

Marling is, as always, enigmatic and hypnotizing, but she is an observer and lets the other characters do the talking; it takes highly skilled actors to command empathy for villains and the cast doesn't disappoint. Alexander Skarsgard is incredibly charismatic and persuasive, and he fills in the blanks admirably whenever his development is cut short. Patricia Clarkson surprises in an unusual role for her - she hints that her character might be more evil than any of the terrorists she is hunting. Jason Ritter and Hillary Baack are affecting in their small roles, and Julia Ormond dominates her five minutes of screen time - her last scene is perhaps the most haunting in the film. Ellen Page gives a career-best performances and reminds us that she's a force to be reckoned with if only she were given the chance to show off more often. She commands the screen with intimidating animosity from the second she walks on screen and has some genuinely heartbreaking moments later on. 

In spite of occasional misfires, the screenplay is exceptional especially in its efficiency: there is so much going on that there isn't much time to devote to individual characters or relationships - Marling and Ritter's suffers the most - but Marling and Batmanglij make every second count as each line is weighted with enough subtext to tell us the stories implicitly and thoroughly nevertheless. The major characters are very well-drawn; even though we only get glimpses into Skarsgard, Page and Kebbell's pasts, we feel we know them inside and out. The film moves along at a fluid, adrenaline-pumping pace and the tension is genuine and organic rather than forced - the audience's investment in the story grows from affection for the characters and connection with their ideals rather than cheap editing tricks, manipulative music and stylized lighting or sound. Music is used so sparsely that when The National's "About Today" plays over a silent montage of Marling's character breaking down, its emotional weight surprises and stuns. The ending is comparatively underwhelming, but the overall package is one of the best, most provocative thrillers in years and firmly establishes Batmanglij and Marling as a sensational and important pairing.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":49468,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2013-06-28","keywords":"anarchist,ecoterrorism,environmental crime,public sex,nude swimming","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2067179033","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMzg2NjU0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODYzNzM0OQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMzg2NjU0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODYzNzM0OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities irrevocably changed after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779870/","name":"Brit Marling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002907/","name":"Alexander Skarsgård"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0680983/","name":"Elliot Page"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2610231/","name":"Zal Batmanglij"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0174373/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0074212/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2610231/","name":"Zal Batmanglij"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779870/","name":"Brit Marling"}],"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Najśmieszniejsze fragmenty z programów polskich stacji TV: gafy popełniane przez prezenterów, ich nietypowe zachowania przed kamerą oraz awarie techniczne powodujące absurdalne sytuacje.

credits.actor: Cezary Pazura, Janusz Rewiński, Jerzy Stuhr, Małgorzata Kożuchowska, Katarzyna Figura, Jan Englert, Jolanta Fraszyńska, Marek Kondrat, Krzysztof Kiersznowski

programme.title: Paper Towns
Papierowe miasta
Paper Towns
programme.desc:
Paper Towns: Directed by Jake Schreier. With Nat Wolff, Cara Delevingne, Austin Abrams, Justice Smith. After an all-night adventure, Quentin's lifelong crush, Margo, disappears, leaving behind clues that Quentin and his friends follow on the journey of a lifetime." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3622592/","name":"Paper Towns","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE2ODQxODMwOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDY5NjY3NDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After an all-night adventure, Quentin's lifelong crush, Margo, disappears, leaving behind clues that Quentin and his friends follow on the journey of a lifetime.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3622592/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mr-ddesouza"},"dateCreated":"2015-12-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed watching this film!","reviewBody":"Is it worth the price of a rental? Yes.

I absolutely loved this movie! As 3 friends come to the end of their senior year. Quentin (played by Nat Wolff) sets out on an adventure likes he's never had before. There is very little that disappointed me in this film. As a matter of fact, my only real complaint was the character of Margo (played by Cara Delevingne), I can't quite put my finger on it but i found her character to be annoying throughout the first act. She was very monotone although she had this opinionated know it all attitude. 

However, since most of the film after that is about finding Margo, her character is not a problem anymore. I realize that the genre of the film is "Drama, Mystery, Romance", I think it is safe to add Adventure , Comedy to the mix. This film made good on the mystery of Margo while adding the adventure of the night before she goes missing along with the adventure that Quentin embarks throughout this entire film looking for Margo. I also found the movie to be very funny with best friends like Radar (played by Justice Smith) and Ben (played by Ben Abrams). These two have completely different characters from one another but together make for a great and funny friendship. Much comedic relief comes from the interaction of the two best friends alone and the scenes where it's all three of them.

I liked the cinematography in this film very much. There were pretty lens flares that I thought were suitable for this type of film and in the scenes that they used them. There was something about the slow motion car shots that I loved as well. A good use of shallow depth of field to concentrate on solely one character at times and no shots that were visually a distraction that I noticed.

I loved all the music that they put into the film. This was a definite plus for me.

Lastly, I love the message of this film. A young man graduating from high school with his whole future planned (college, marriage, kids, career) only to realize that life is more than just those things. That you can have an adventure through it all and that friends are so important and that you need to cherish friendships and enjoy them to the fullest before everyone goes their separate ways. This is a movie that I would recommend anyone watch. Live life to the fullest, have an adventure and don't let life pass you by. I am definitely planning on watching this film again in the near future. Hopefully I can better describe the feeling it gives me when I do.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":98894,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-07-24","keywords":"based on novel,travel,teenage girl,unrequited love,friendship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2452795417","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkyNjAxNDc3MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDMxNDg4NTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkyNjAxNDc3MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDMxNDg4NTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A coming-of-age story centering on Quentin and his enigmatic neighbor Margo, who loved mysteries so much she became one. After taking him on an all-night adventure through their hometown, Margo suddenly disappears - leaving behind cryptic clues for Quentin to decipher. The search leads Quentin and his quick-witted friends on an exhilarating adventure that is equal parts hilarious and moving. Ultimately, to track down Margo, Quentin must find a deeper understanding of true friendship - and true love."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1822659/","name":"Nat Wolff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5353321/","name":"Cara Delevingne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3641002/","name":"Austin Abrams"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1500577/","name":"Jake Schreier"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017497/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0069651/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2354099/","name":"Scott Neustadter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2352210/","name":"Michael H. Weber"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1981261/","name":"John Green"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Descendants
Spadkobiercy
The Descendants
programme.desc:
The Descendants: Directed by Alexander Payne. With George Clooney, Shailene Woodley, Amara Miller, Nick Krause. A land baron tries to reconnect with his two daughters after his wife is seriously injured in a boating accident." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1033575/","name":"The Descendants","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAyNTA1MTcyN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjEyODczNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A land baron tries to reconnect with his two daughters after his wife is seriously injured in a boating accident.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1033575/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Red_Identity"},"dateCreated":"2012-01-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pretty excellent, but definitely sort of odd","reviewBody":"I never really had high expectations for The Descendants. First off, I have never seen an Alexander Payne film, and the story itself sort of seemed like the type of film that would end up on a long list of solid films that end up being unmemorable. Much to my surprise, it has a sort of tone that you don't see often in these types of films.

This is a film that carefully treads around the edges. I wouldn't say it ever became too sentimental. Yet I also expected a snappy dialogue- filled, fast-paced dramedy, sort of like Reitman's Up in the Air, that other Clooney film. The film is written and plays out like a real life situation. One could maybe try to say that about any film like this, but here it rings true. To say it's slow or fast paced isn't really what matters, but what matters is how much it develops its characters with real richness and detail. In a way, the screenplay is helped a lot by Payne as a director, not because the writing is thin, but because the direction allows the film to feel sort of spontaneous. This isn't a film full of twists or turns, and yet at every corner when you try to analyze it, you realize how unpredictable it all feels. 

I have also heard one thing about it in many reviews, and that is how it's messy like life. One can easily read those descriptions and just roll his or her eyes, but that description really holds truth. The film doesn't feel to glamorous or stylized. It certainly isn't the dramedy with witty one liners that I expected. Instead, when it's all over, you take a step back and realize that it all feels sort of messy. It's not complicated, and in fact it's a pretty simple film, but even the editing helps this certain mood that the film leaves you in. It's simple, yet hard to really pinpoint and describe how it all comes together or how it's something of real importance. This is completely refreshing, especially when films these days hammer you with these sort of messages or details.

I now want to talk about the performances, which are stellar. Clooney just won the Globe a couple of hours ago, and now I look at it and think to myself "wow... of all of his performances, this is getting him awards?". It's a very restrained performance, and no, it isn't a transformation. Some will once again say that Clooney is only "playing himself", but to me, when Clooney does great, he really nails it. He gives all of his performances something distinct about them, and this is perhaps his wild-card character. He doesn't add in his usual smoothness that we see a lot from him. This stands apart, and I am surprised for that reason for its success. Shailene Woodley is fantastic here as well, and really impressed me with the sort of indignation and maturity that she mixes together. She's better than most of the contenders for the Oscar in her category, more specifically Octavia Spencer, Melissa McCarthy, and Janet McTeer.

I loved this film. I wasn't sure of it while I was seeing it, but after it's over, as hard as it is to really describe and know why I enjoyed it so much, I did. The sort of atmosphere and mood that it had me in doesn't come along very often, especially not with dramas like this."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":236597,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2011-12-09","keywords":"father daughter relationship,boating accident,hawaii,cheating wife,dying mother","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4144471577","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA1NzQ4Mzc5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjcyMTkwNw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA1NzQ4Mzc5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjcyMTkwNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A land baron tries to re-connect with his two daughters after his wife suffers a boating accident. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000123/","name":"George Clooney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0940362/","name":"Shailene Woodley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3837786/","name":"Amara Miller"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668247/","name":"Alexander Payne"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028932/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0171502/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0174373/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668247/","name":"Alexander Payne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0269542/","name":"Nat Faxon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0711110/","name":"Jim Rash"}],"duration":"PT1H55M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Military Wives
Pojedynek na głosy
Military Wives
programme.desc:
Military Wives: Directed by Peter Cattaneo. With Kristin Scott Thomas, Sharon Horgan, Emma Lowndes, Gaby French. With their partners away serving in Afghanistan, a group of women on the home front form a choir and quickly find themselves at the center of a media sensation and global movement." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8951692/","name":"Military Wives","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWUxZGJkNjgtMDFjMC00ZTFiLTlmMGMtZGZmNWY4N2FlOWE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTI4MzE4MDU@._V1_.jpg","description":"With their partners away serving in Afghanistan, a group of women on the home front form a choir and quickly find themselves at the center of a media sensation and global movement.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8951692/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"iamkeysersoze-13228"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not perfect but still worth watching","reviewBody":"Military Wives is as formulaic as movies go, regardless the film is surprisingly good and it uses the formula really well. However it never aspires to be anything else preventing it from becoming a classic amongst the genre.

I haven't been familiar with the true story but from the start, you just know where it is all gonna go. It still works well but nothing is a surprise because of that. It still has some great moments and a fair amount of heart

It is seriously enjoyable and it is a likeable movie with a great cast. Kristen Scott Thomas and Sharon Horgan are great here. I'm sure there are many people who will like this film. I just can't see that much greatness in it. It's formulaic and does it's best to be a lovely and charming film but it does it in such a manipulative way, and I hate it when films do that. It is still worth watching though"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4325,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2020-03-06","keywords":"friendship,singing,bus,drinking,bar","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4201561881","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTRkODczMzQtNDJjZS00ZjU0LTk3NTctZDMwNmM2MzViMTZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTRkODczMzQtNDJjZS00ZjU0LTk3NTctZDMwNmM2MzViMTZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000218/","name":"Kristin Scott Thomas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1279721/","name":"Sharon Horgan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1266378/","name":"Emma Lowndes"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0146341/","name":"Peter Cattaneo"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0407896/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0209925/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0784476/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2074041/","name":"Rachel Tunnard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1598473/","name":"Rosanne Flynn"}],"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Fourmi
Mój mały mistrz
Fourmi
programme.desc:
Fourmi: Directed by Julien Rappeneau. With François Damiens, Maleaume Paquin, André Dussollier, Ludivine Sagnier. Théo would like to give some hope to his father, Laurent, a lonely alcoholic and disillusioned with life. The opportunity comes when Théo is about to be signed by Arsenal FC." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9767556/","name":"Fourmi","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY0MjFiM2EtNmIxMy00NjIwLWFiNjctOTAxODBkMTNlZDllXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODIyOTEyMzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Théo would like to give some hope to his father, Laurent, a lonely alcoholic and disillusioned with life. The opportunity comes when Théo is about to be signed by Arsenal FC.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9767556/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ulicknormanowen"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"A lie can save a human wreck.","reviewBody":"François Damiens is the stand out ,in his portrayal of a man,Laurent , who has lost everything ,even the custody of his only child, a teenage whiz kid ;considering the limitations he's working under,he's to be commended : the divorced man ,whose wife started a new life with a well-respected man who tries to win the boy's affection,a brat who has only eyes for his dad who of course sank into alcoholism ,it is a cliché to end all the clichés.

Laurent is really a poor pitiful man whose son's gift for football is his only reason to cling to life ;he's even become persona non grata on the football field,and,supreme vexation, he's denied to attend his boy's last game. Although he was not selected by the Arsenal FC recruiter ,Theo makes his father believe he is actually about to sign to the prestigious club.

Overnight ,helped by a devoted social worker , the overwrought man changes : he will find a job, he will learn English with a walkman and cassettes ( is it still used ?says the social worker), and ,last but not least ,he will quit drinking (a few relapses will happen). "Fourmi " (=ant;the football wizard is too short to be signed to Arsenal )is the story of a redemption.Theo knows that ,if he does not qualify for the selection,his father's life is irreparably doomed ;so he's compelled to lie to his coach (André Dussolier) and his assistant (who seems to prefer pastry cook to football,so do I).

Only his good friend,Karim is in secret ;as for the youngsters ' performances ,it's uneven :it goes from good (Laurent,Karim) to mediocre (Max ,the computer wizzard :how could you believe this giddy jerk would be able to write an email using the perfect club jargon,? the young actor acts as if he does not care)

The subject of the movie is a man's redemption ;it renders the denouement null and void ,a crowd-pleaser ,the expected event ; the movie would have been a hundred times more convincing without it , and reductio ad aburdum that a lie can be vital to save a human life .And that a man can help himself ,and ,after a while does not need his son's prowesses to be a human being again ( the bedroom he paints for him speaks volumes about his metamorphosis).And Mr Damiens was up to programme.title: La daronne
La daronne
programme.desc: La daronne: Directed by Jean-Paul Salomé. With Isabelle Huppert, Hippolyte Girardot, Farida Ouchani, Liliane Rovère. A translator working for the police gets involved in the other side of drug dealing." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9288726/","name":"La daronne","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWQxYjNiOGYtZDNiOC00OWY2LTkxNjQtY2VhODYzNDk5ZjE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDU0NjMyNTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A translator working for the police gets involved in the other side of drug dealing.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9288726/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2020-10-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Getting it","reviewBody":"Isabelle Huppert - just the name alone should be enough for some to not even think twice about how they will feel about this movie. And she is really getting it - well done. Now morally speaking there are things that will be going on, that not everyone will agree with. Maybe that is the wrong way of putting it. But you'll know what I mean when you see the movie (or even the trailer I assume).\n\nThe movie is very well thought of and is quite the entertaining ride - while the subject matter is serious and there are certain scenes that are on the violent side - overall the tone is that of a comedy. Acting overall is top notch, there are certain things that may feel like an easy way out (problems that almost literally disappear to a degree) ... and the ending is something that while nice, is nothing that is as amazing or gives the movie an extra push ... but maybe that is nitpicking. Just enjoy the thriller ride with a lot of laughs (and still some social message hidden in there)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1950,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-09-09","keywords":"female translator,female drug dealer,retirement home,wind turbine,police","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2064367385","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTFlNjk4ZDAtMjRiNC00M2Q4LTk3MzktNDM4N2Q5MmRjYTE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTFlNjk4ZDAtMjRiNC00M2Q4LTk3MzktNDM4N2Q5MmRjYTE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001376/","name":"Isabelle Huppert"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0320762/","name":"Hippolyte Girardot"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1560551/","name":"Farida Ouchani"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0758933/","name":"Jean-Paul Salomé"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056792/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0690980/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0230609/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1163751/","name":"Hannelore Cayre"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0758933/","name":"Jean-Paul Salomé"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3854210/","name":"Antoine Salomé"}],"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Capone
Capone
programme.desc:
Capone: Directed by Josh Trank. With Tom Hardy, Linda Cardellini, Matt Dillon, Al Sapienza. The 47-year old Al Capone, after 10 years in prison, starts suffering from dementia and comes to be haunted by his violent past." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6199572/","name":"Capone","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTVmMDU3MjctMmUxNi00NzI3LWI1NGMtMmY5MjE0MGVlMzAwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODk4OTc3MTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"The 47-year old Al Capone, after 10 years in prison, starts suffering from dementia and comes to be haunted by his violent past.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6199572/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ripleyspussy"},"dateCreated":"2020-05-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"There's hardly a reference for this kind of film; it's not a traditional narrative in any sense","reviewBody":"I admired the film more than I enjoyed it, but it kept my interest throughout despite being a bit of slog at times. It's fascinating. The title 'Capone' invokes the expectation that this was a biopic of the famous gangster, but this isn't that at all. This is something very different, and very deliberately so, but due to the title it's going to confuse and disappoint most people (which is why Trank hated that he had to change it from the original title 'Fonzo' for marketing reasons). There's hardly a reference for this kind of film; it's not a traditional narrative in any sense.

What I keep thinking about is how even most gangster films who pretend to de-glamorize criminals and their lifestyle fail; it's the same problem with the "anti-" war movie that still depicts a rousing, exciting adventure next to the misery and the atrocities and thus defeats its own purpose. Rare is the war or gangster film that actually achieves to show the underlying emptiness; the ugly, banal, vulgar and sad reality that ultimately is what most lives of violence lead towards until the haunting memories are the only thing that remains.

The reason for that is obvious: nobody would watch that kind of film because it would be too bleak. But 'Capone' manages that rare feat: it's bleak - but not bleak enough to turn you off, and it's even often entertaining (in terms of its performances, the fantastic score, the beautiful cinematography). But even though this probably wasn't the film's intention, it still manages to be the ultimate deconstruction of the gangster as an "icon" - more so even than Scorsese's 'Irishman' (though it's nowhere near as good a film).

I liked Capone; it's weird (and I guess you shouldn't watch it unless you like profoundly weird little arthouse films) but this is definitely not a badly made film. I hope Trank continues on this path and makes more strange, personal films - although perhaps of the kind that are a little more accessible."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18551,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-05-12","keywords":"gangster,one word title,diaper,adult diaper,feces","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1375387161","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODYzODBlZjQtMDIyNy00ZjkwLWFhM2QtYTAyMzM0OTc1YzJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODYzODBlZjQtMDIyNy00ZjkwLWFhM2QtYTAyMzM0OTc1YzJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","description":"The 47-year old Al Capone, after 10 years in prison, starts suffering from dementia and comes to be haunted by his violent past."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0362766/","name":"Tom Hardy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004802/","name":"Linda Cardellini"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000369/","name":"Matt Dillon"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2503633/","name":"Josh Trank"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0309252/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019267/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0563088/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2503633/","name":"Josh Trank"}],"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="

It's fascinating. The title 'Capone' invokes the expectation that this was a biopic of the famous gangster, but this isn't that at all. This is something very different, and very deliberately so, but due to the title it's going to confuse and disappoint most people (which is why Trank hated that he had to change it from the original title 'Fonzo' for marketing reasons). There's hardly a reference for this kind of film; it's not a traditional narrative in any sense.

What I keep thinking about is how even most gangster films who pretend to de-glamorize criminals and their lifestyle fail; it's the same problem with the "anti-" war movie that still depicts a rousing, exciting adventure next to the misery and the atrocities and thus defeats its own purpose. Rare is the war or gangster film that actually achieves to show the underlying emptiness; the ugly, banal, vulgar and sad reality that ultimately is what most lives of violence lead towards until the haunting memories are the only thing that remains.

The reason for that is obvious: nobody would watch that kind of film because it would be too bleak. But 'Capone' manages that rare feat: it's bleak - but not bleak enough to turn you off, and it's even often entertaining (in terms of its performances, the fantastic score, the beautiful cinematography). But even though this probably wasn't the film's intention, it still manages to be the ultimate deconstruction of the gangster as an "icon" - more so even than Scorsese's 'Irishman' (though it's nowhere near as good a film).

I liked Capone; it's weird (and I guess you shouldn't watch it unless you like profoundly weird little arthouse films) but this is definitely not a badly made film. I hope Trank continues on this path and makes more strange, personal films - although perhaps of the kind that are a little more accessible.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18551,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.7,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-05-12","keywords":"gangster,one word title,diaper,adult diaper,feces","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1375387161","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODYzODBlZjQtMDIyNy00ZjkwLWFhM2QtYTAyMzM0OTc1YzJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODYzODBlZjQtMDIyNy00ZjkwLWFhM2QtYTAyMzM0OTc1YzJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","description":"The 47-year old Al Capone, after 10 years in prison, starts suffering from dementia and comes to be haunted by his violent past.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0362766/","name":"Tom Hardy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004802/","name":"Linda Cardellini","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000369/","name":"Matt Dillon"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2503633/","name":"Josh Trank"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0309252/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019267/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0563088/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2503633/","name":"Josh Trank"],"duration":"PT1H43M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Z odzysku
Z odzysku
programme.desc:
Z odzysku: Directed by Slawomir Fabicki. With Antoni Pawlicki, Nataliya Vdovina, Jacek Braciak, Dimitri Melnichuk. 19 year old Wojtek lives in a poverty stricken Polish town. He is in love with an older woman, an illegal emigrant from Ukraine. He boxes in illegal matches to get money and is spotted by a man running a security business. Accepting this man's offer means becoming a gangster, but this could allow him to a residence permit for his girlfriend Katya." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0800275/","name":"Z odzysku","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDAwYmI3NGMtZTJhOS00NDQ4LWIwN2EtZjFmYjA4ODQ0MDg4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"19 year old Wojtek lives in a poverty stricken Polish town. He is in love with an older woman, an illegal emigrant from Ukraine. He boxes in illegal matches to get money and is spotted by a man running a security business. Accepting ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0800275/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sclerozo"},"dateCreated":"2008-12-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Weak and shallow plot and result is a dismal movie","reviewBody":"I was unlucky to see this movie at the Toronto International Film Festival and now by chance I came across it on IDMB. I was hoping it might have been a movie I missed and after realizing what it is I decided to post my comment.

I can't believe how this pathetic movie garnered some awards as it appears to have. The plot is banal and approaches stupid as the unconvincing downfall of this man is portrayed. Somehow the director tries to portray that hard work will get you nowhere in post-communist Poland and the attachment with a gang lifestyle also leads to a calamity. The ending is so abrupt and unexpected that it leaves the audience wondering whether the film reel missed a splicing. 

I would like to watch a Polish movie worthy of the time to see it and this one falls so far behind that and I truly regret the wasted time.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":359,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2006-11-17","keywords":"fall from height,accident,kissing,male female relationship,marriage proposal","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2252397/","name":"Antoni Pawlicki"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0891502/","name":"Nataliya Vdovina"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0102765/","name":"Jacek Braciak"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0264614/","name":"Slawomir Fabicki"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043688/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0147152/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054609/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0264614/","name":"Slawomir Fabicki"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0367885/","name":"Denijal Hasanovic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2256587/","name":"Marek Pruchniewski"}],"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Zloto dezerterów
Złoto dezerterów
programme.desc:
Zloto dezerterów: Directed by Janusz Majewski. With Marek Kondrat, Boguslaw Linda, Wiktor Zborowski, Katarzyna Figura. During World War II a group of safe-crackers sets off on a mission to steal gold from a Nazi bank." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0191666/","name":"Zloto dezerterów","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzM4OTI4ZGUtNmQyZS00NjZiLWE4OWUtNDA3Y2RkOGE4ZTkzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"During World War II a group of safe-crackers sets off on a mission to steal gold from a Nazi bank.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0191666/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Maziun"},"dateCreated":"2013-08-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Bad sequel to fun movie","reviewBody":"This is a sequel to movie from 1985 – HK Deserters" . The heroes from the first movie also appear here , but there is plenty of new heroes . The first movie was a war comedy about a group of friends running away from army . This one is supposed to be a war comedy about stealing gold from Nazi's.

It was supposed to be comedy . Unfortunately the movie takes itself way too seriously . The movie unnecessary tries to tell something about anti-Semitism , betrayal and courage of freedom fighters. For more than half of the movie is hard to tell that this is comedy . When the so-called jokes appear in the second half of the movie they so awful you will groan. The movie also feels too long (it's 2 hours long ) , which wasn't a problem in the first movie (which was almost 3 hours long) . Gone is the charm and the fun of original.

The acting is good and the music is very jolly . Still , it's too little to save the movie from being a disaster. I give it 1/10. Better watch "Kelly's heroes". Or the original – "HK Deserters".","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":487,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5},"genre":["Action","Comedy","War"],"datePublished":"1998-12-04","keywords":"1940s,world war two","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0464945/","name":"Marek Kondrat"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0511277/","name":"Boguslaw Linda"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953975/","name":"Wiktor Zborowski"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0538105/","name":"Janusz Majewski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0538105/","name":"Janusz Majewski"}],"duration":"PT2H3M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: "Zasada przyjemności" - making of
programme.desc: W trakcie II wojny światowej z Polski zniknęły setki tysięcy bezcennych dzieł sztuki. Zarówno niemieccy, jak i radzieccy okupanci masowo wywozili obrazy i rzeźby. Nie wszystkie udało się odzyskać. Obecnie wiele z tych polskich zbiorów rozsianych jest po całym świecie. Historyk sztuki Jerzy S. Majewski przybliża losy tych zrabowanych dóbr. Snuje opowieść o skradzionym dorobku wielu wspaniałych artystów i wyjaśnia, co się z nim dokładnie stało.

programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 13513268, Title: Klangor, --- Description: Klangor: With Arkadiusz Jakubik, Maja Ostaszewska, Aleksandra Poplawska, Wojciech Mecwaldowski. A missing teenager and the father desperately begins his search on his own. The dramatic situation his family is in deepens the crisis of their mutual relations, misunderstanding, emotional distance and lack of ties." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt13513268/","name":"Klangor","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTNlNDFjYWEtOGRlNS00MDI0LWFhYjctZmMyMDk4MTE0M2Q2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTI3OTc5MjMy._V1_.jpg","description":"A missing teenager and the father desperately begins his search on his own. The dramatic situation his family is in deepens the crisis of their mutual relations, misunderstanding, emotional distance and lack of ties.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt13513268/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"aleksypotocki","dateCreated":"2021-05-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Masterpiece. A breeze of fresh air in the genre.","reviewBody":"Admittedly, I felt very skeptical learning about a new polish production. Especially in a well-trodden genre of "missing-relative vs ncompetent-police vs genius-relative". I was proven wrong, so, so wrong from the very start till the very end. Klangor is an absolute masterpiece, briliant, captivating plot, amazing acting crew with a cherry on top soundtrack, building a wild ride through beuatiful polish landscapes. Unlike many others, it completes the experience with a very satisfying, bittersweet, yet really cohesive series finale. Give it a shot, its more than worth it.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":268,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6,"genre":["Crime"],"datePublished":"2021-03-26","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1458971/","name":"Arkadiusz Jakubik","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0652292/","name":"Maja Ostaszewska","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1728821/","name":"Aleksandra Poplawska"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0506795/"]</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Lifting wnętrz z Marią Semczyszyn
programme.desc: Maria Semczyszyn wraz ze swym kompanem, Wieśkiem, pomaga w błyskawicznym re-designie pokojów, których obecny wygląd z różnych powodów nie zadowala właścicieli. Zadanie nie należy do łatwych - to właściciele decydują, w jakim stylu mają być urządzone pomieszczenia. Dekoratorka musi sprostać ich oczekiwaniom, niejednokrotnie przedstawiając projekty, które kłócą się z jej własnym gustem.

programme.title: News+
programme.desc: Podsumowanie najważniejszych wydarzeń z aren sportowych. Omówienie sukcesów, rekordów i porażek. Program prowadzą zamiennie m.in. Piotr Karpiński, Piotr Salak, Wojciech Zawioła i Gabriel Rogaczewski.

programme.title: Tenis: Turniej WTA w Ostrawie
programme.desc: Cykl wywiadów przeprowadzanych przez Tomka Ćwiąkałę z ważnymi postaciami ze świata futbolu. Wśród nich są mistrzowie świata, Europy i gwiazdy topowych lig. Widzowie dowiedzą się, czym zajmują się dzisiaj, jak wspominają swoje kariery oraz poznają ich plany na przyszłość.

programme.title: Zielona rewolucja Marty Dymek 2
programme.desc: Marta Dymek przeprowadza w kuchni rewolucję. Przekonuje mięsożerców do potraw wegańskich. Wśród jej gości znajdą się złoty medalista z Pekinu Piotr Małachowski i kucharki z baru mlecznego.

programme.title: ABC gotowania - kuchnia włoska
programme.desc: Sztuka kulinarna we Włoszech opiera się na prostych potrawach przygotowanych z dobrych składników. Oliwa z oliwek, warzywa i zioła, sery, ryby, owoce morza, jajka, mąka i oliwki to podstawy wielu dań.

programme.title: Jakubiak rodzinnie
programme.desc: Gotowanie jest znakomitym pretekstem do spędzania czasu z rodziną. Znany szef kuchni Tomasz Jakubiak zachęca do dzielenia się z bliskimi pysznymi daniami. Sam w programie przedstawi członków swojej rodziny: mamę, tatę, siostrę oraz narzeczoną. Wraz z nimi w każdym odcinku zaprezentuje proste pomysły na śniadanie, obiad i kolację. Nie zabraknie anegdot z życia kucharza oraz cennych wskazówek kulinarnych.

programme.title: Meblokreacje 5
programme.desc: Artur Indyka podejmuje się ciekawych wyzwań. Przedstawia świeże pomysły na stare meble i dodatki do wnętrz. Pozornie bezużyteczne przedmioty zyskują drugie życie i nowe funkcje. Ekspert zajmuje się m.in. starymi skrzyniami wojskowymi, z których powstaje designerski regał pod RTV czy dziecięcym łóżkiem, przerobionym na serwantkę. Nie brakuje też rozwiązań w duchu "zero waste", takich jak wykorzystanie plastikowych słomek jako tworzywa do ramy lustra.

programme.title: Meblokreacje 5

programme.title: Pogotowie remontowe Wieśka 4
programme.desc: Wiesiek Skiba pomaga ludziom, którzy stali się ofiarami nierzetelnych firm remontowych. Specjalista naprawi rozmaite usterki zgłoszone przez widzów. Udowodni też, że wiele drobnych remontów w kuchni, łazience, salonie czy na tarasie można zrobić samodzielnie.

programme.title: Remont w 48h
programme.desc: Tomasz Pągowski odwiedza ludzi, którzy chcieliby zrobić w swoim mieszkaniu remont, ale boją się kosztów i utrudnień. Architekt udowodni im, że metamorfozę można przeprowadzić szybko, tanio i bezproblemowo.

programme.title: Remont w 48h

programme.title: Lifting wnętrz z Marią Semczyszyn
programme.desc: Maria Semczyszyn wraz ze swym kompanem, Wieśkiem, pomaga w błyskawicznym re-designie pokojów, których obecny wygląd z różnych powodów nie zadowala właścicieli. Zadanie nie należy do łatwych - to właściciele decydują, w jakim stylu mają być urządzone pomieszczenia. Dekoratorka musi sprostać ich oczekiwaniom, niejednokrotnie przedstawiając projekty, które kłócą się z jej własnym gustem.

programme.title: Zielona rewolucja Marty Dymek 2
programme.desc: Marta Dymek przeprowadza w kuchni rewolucję. Przekonuje mięsożerców do potraw wegańskich. Wśród jej gości znajdą się złoty medalista z Pekinu Piotr Małachowski i kucharki z baru mlecznego.

programme.title: ABC gotowania - kuchnia włoska
programme.desc: Sztuka kulinarna we Włoszech opiera się na prostych potrawach przygotowanych z dobrych składników. Oliwa z oliwek, warzywa i zioła, sery, ryby, owoce morza, jajka, mąka i oliwki to podstawy wielu dań.

programme.title: Jakubiak rodzinnie
programme.desc: Gotowanie jest znakomitym pretekstem do spędzania czasu z rodziną. Znany szef kuchni Tomasz Jakubiak zachęca do dzielenia się z bliskimi pysznymi daniami. Sam w programie przedstawi członków swojej rodziny: mamę, tatę, siostrę oraz narzeczoną. Wraz z nimi w każdym odcinku zaprezentuje proste pomysły na śniadanie, obiad i kolację. Nie zabraknie anegdot z życia kucharza oraz cennych wskazówek kulinarnych.

programme.title: Meblokreacje 5
programme.desc: Artur Indyka podejmuje się ciekawych wyzwań. Przedstawia świeże pomysły na stare meble i dodatki do wnętrz. Pozornie bezużyteczne przedmioty zyskują drugie życie i nowe funkcje. Ekspert zajmuje się m.in. starymi skrzyniami wojskowymi, z których powstaje designerski regał pod RTV czy dziecięcym łóżkiem, przerobionym na serwantkę. Nie brakuje też rozwiązań w duchu "zero waste", takich jak wykorzystanie plastikowych słomek jako tworzywa do ramy lustra.

programme.title: Meblokreacje 5

programme.title: Pogotowie remontowe Wieśka 4
programme.desc: Wiesiek Skiba pomaga ludziom, którzy stali się ofiarami nierzetelnych firm remontowych. Specjalista naprawi rozmaite usterki zgłoszone przez widzów. Udowodni też, że wiele drobnych remontów w kuchni, łazience, salonie czy na tarasie można zrobić samodzielnie.

programme.title: Jestem REN
Jestem REN
programme.desc: Jestem REN: Directed by Patricia Ryczko. With Marta Król, Marcin Sztabinski, Marieta Zukowska, Janusz Chabior. We meet a mother quietly obsessing over the sudden change in her family's life. Gradually we learn she is an android, and has suffered a glitch. The company puts her into therapy in order to assess the damage. She comes to see that her android self is her own fantasy. She begins to cooperate with the therapy, realizing she will be able to return to her family." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11067160/","name":"Jestem REN","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTFiNDYxZDQtYzZjOC00NmU5LTllYjEtZjc4MWFhZGRhZTllXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzUwOTc4NjY@._V1_.jpg","description":"We meet a mother quietly obsessing over the sudden change in her family's life. Gradually we learn she is an android, and has suffered a glitch. The company puts her into therapy in order to assess the damage. She comes to see that h","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11067160/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"fxflinn"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Thought provoking parable of mental illness","reviewBody":"Caught this at the Boston Science Fiction Film Festival in Feb 2020. It's a tidy, well made film that draws you into a family battling the mental illness of the mother, who believes she is a sentient android who has malfunctioned. But maybe she is a human who has constructed an elaborate backstory to hide from the pain of being a person who cannot love and who cannot stop beating her on-the-cusp of manhood son. The material clues suggest we are in our time, not some future echoing the television series "Humans," but we are looking at the world through the eyes of the narrator, the mother, and she sees clues about her android origin everywhere. By the time the movie reaches its conclusion, you've been drawn into the madness, the uncertainty of what is human, what is programming, and profound discomfort for the mom and her interior life. The dedication at the end of the film makes it clear the filmmaker wanted to share his experience with his mother and her struggle. He succeeded. The intimate cinematography is a case study in how closeups and lighting can draw an audience into the interior life of the characters. IMDb data; ttnr: 11067160, Title: Jestem REN, --- Description: Jestem REN: Directed by Patricia Ryczko. With Marta Król, Marcin Sztabinski, Marieta Zukowska, Janusz Chabior. We meet a mother quietly obsessing over the sudden change in her family's life. Gradually we learn she is an android, and has suffered a glitch. The company puts her into therapy in order to assess the damage. She comes to see that her android self is her own fantasy. She begins to cooperate with the therapy, realizing she will be able to return to her family." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11067160/","name":"Jestem REN","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTFiNDYxZDQtYzZjOC00NmU5LTllYjEtZjc4MWFhZGRhZTllXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzUwOTc4NjY@._V1_.jpg","description":"We meet a mother quietly obsessing over the sudden change in her family's life. Gradually we learn she is an android, and has suffered a glitch. The company puts her into therapy in order to assess the damage. She comes to see that h","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11067160/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"fxflinn","dateCreated":"2020-02-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Thought provoking parable of mental illness","reviewBody":"Caught this at the Boston Science Fiction Film Festival in Feb 2020. It's a tidy, well made film that draws you into a family battling the mental illness of the mother, who believes she is a sentient android who has malfunctioned. But maybe she is a human who has constructed an elaborate backstory to hide from the pain of being a person who cannot love and who cannot stop beating her on-the-cusp of manhood son. The material clues suggest we are in our time, not some future echoing the television series "Humans," but we are looking at the world through the eyes of the narrator, the mother, and she sees clues about her android origin everywhere. By the time the movie reaches its conclusion, you've been drawn into the madness, the uncertainty of what is human, what is programming, and profound discomfort for the mom and her interior life. The dedication at the end of the film makes it clear the filmmaker wanted to share his experience with his mother and her struggle. He succeeded. The intimate cinematography is a case study in how closeups and lighting can draw an audience into the interior life of the characters. The actors all do a fine job, particularly Marta Krol in the role of the mother and Marieta Zukowska as her peer, counterpart, alter ego or therapist -- when you are in psychosis, those around you play many roles.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":72,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4,"genre":["Drama","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-03-27","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2067989/","name":"Marta Król","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2029225/","name":"Marcin Sztabinski","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2346424/","name":"Marieta Zukowska"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2253296/","name":"Patricia Ryczko"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0734708/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0767135/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0778711/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2253296/","name":"Patricia Ryczko"],"duration":"PT1H15M"</script><metacontent="

Melchiora Wańkowicza (Marek Karpowicz), Janusza Kusocińskiego, Eugeniusza Kwiatkowskiego i Hankę Ordonównę.

A detective investigates the death of a patriarch of an eccentric, combative family." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8946378/","name":"Knives Out","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGUwZjliMTAtNzAxZi00MWNiLWE2NzgtZGUxMGQxZjhhNDRiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU1NzU3MzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A detective investigates the death of a patriarch of an eccentric, combative family.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8946378/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"pere-25366"},"dateCreated":"2019-11-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Bringing back the classic whoddunit in amazingly entertaining fashion - 8/10 ⭐","reviewBody":"What an excellent film by Rian Johnson; definitely feels like the film he was destined to make.
